intro: Ruschia bracteata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of fleshy, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, known as farina. Ruschia bracteata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought-resistant nature.
